variables.label: Outline Version
variables.description: Check out their page for the valid tags https://hub.docker.com/r/outlinewiki/outline/tags

variables.label: Postgres Version
variables.description: Check out their page for the valid tags https://hub.docker.com/_/postgres?tab=tags

variables.label: Redis Version
variables.description: Check out their Docker page for the valid tags https://hub.docker.com/_/redis?tab=tags

variables.label: SECRET_KEY
variables.description: Run this command to generate a key: `openssl rand -hex 32`

variables.label: UTILS_SECRET
variables.description: Run this command to generate a key: `openssl rand -hex 32`

variables.label: S3 Storage compatible API URL for instance Minio, AWS, etc.
variables.description: NB: You can have your own S3 storage by using the Open Source Minio alternative (there is a Caprover one-click-apps for that)

variables.label: S3 Storage region
variables.description: Name of the location of the server e.g. "us-west-rack2"

variables.label: S3 Storage bucket name
variables.description: Log into the Minio dashboard, then select the `Create Bucket` menu option to create a new bucket (e.g. named outline-data). Don't forget to add `Read and Write` policy to the bucket so the Outline app would be able to upload content

variables.label: S3 storage Access Key ID
variables.description: For instance in your Minio instance, create a new user called outline_user for the outline app with a new policy that grants full access inside the bucket (e.g. outlineAppFullAccess - see also https://wiki.generaloutline.com/share/125de1cc-9ff6-424b-8415-0d58c809a40f#h-iam-policy)

variables.label: S3 storage Secret Access Key
variables.description: For instance in your Minio instance it correponds to the password/secret of above outline_user

variables.label: Client ID created in your Generic OIDC server (e.g. in Keycloak)
variables.description: E.g. for Keycloak: In the Clients section, create a new client application. Name the app outline_app for simplicity. Also, provide the Root URL where you have installed/planned to install Outline. After that, make sure `Access Type` is set to `confidential` and `Direct Access Grants Enabled` is `OFF` so the Oauth flow initiated by Outline can work as expected.

variables.label: Secret for the corresponding Client ID
variables.description: Found in the Credentials tab in Keycloak

variables.label: Authorization Endpoint
variables.description: In the recent version of Keycloak, the path /auth/ is optional, and the default master realm is not recommended for anything else except managing Keycloak itself. For example you could name the realm `outline`: http://localhost:8080/realms/outline/protocol/openid-connect/auth

variables.label: Token Management Endpoint
variables.description: For example with the realm named `outline`: http://localhost:8080/realms/outline/protocol/openid-connect/token

variables.label: User Informations Endpoint
variables.description: For example with the realm named `outline`: http://localhost:8080/realms/outline/protocol/openid-connect/userinfo

variables.label: SMTP host
variables.description: To support sending outgoing transactional emails such as "document updated" or "you've been invited" you'll need to provide authentication for an SMTP server

variables.label: The default interface language
variables.description: See translate.getoutline.com for a list of available language codes and their rough percentage translated.

instructions.start:
Outline is an open, extensible, wiki for your team built using React and Node.js.

Outline requires an external authentication provider such as Google/Slack, etc.  If you don't want to rely on those solutions you can use a generic OpenID Connect Server.  For instance you can use the Open Source Keycloak alternative (there is a Caprover one-click-apps for that)

IMPORTANT: You need to, at least, set one 3rd party login method, either Keycloak, Slack or Google

description: An open, extensible, wiki for your team built using React and Node.js.
